info_request.title: Locations of council pitches for van dwellers

public_body.name: Bristol City Council
public_body.notes: The UK has multiple tiers of local government and not all local authorities have responsibility for education. This public authority is one of around 200 local authorities in England, Scotland and Wales which do have responsibilities for education. This council has the functions of a district level council. Councils of this type are usually the primary planning authority and council tax billing authority and have responsibility for, among other things, refuse collection, housing, food safety inspections, dog wardens, parks and street cleaning as well as cemeteries and crematoria. It is our understanding that this is a Council with Adult Social Services Responsibilities.

user.name: The Bristol Tree Forum
user.about_me:
We are a group of volunteers dedicated to protecting and increasing the tree canopy cover of Bristol’s urban forest.

Why? Because tree cover brings so many benefits to an urban environment: a shared amenity, public health, economic growth, reduced pollution and flooding, wildlife, food and a better sense of well-being.

We can be found at https://bristoltreeforum.org/
